collector.eventConditionClassDetect: Every time specified class is detected
collector.areaDetectTypeHelp: * Required when event condition is "Only on area entry/exit"
collector.detectAreaRequired: * Required Example: [[100,100],[200,100],[200,200],[100,200]] (Required when event condition is "Only on area entry/exit")
collector.yoloModelPathHelp: Available models: v9-s, v9-m, v9-c, v9-t, v9-c-cls, v9-c-seg, v7, rd-9c (Default: v9-s). You can also place your own trained models in shared/yolo_detector/yolo/config/model directory. Note: Runs on CPU, larger models (e.g., v9-c) may impact real-time performance. v9-t or v9-s recommended.
collector.errorConfidenceRange: Confidence threshold must be between 0.1 and 1.0
collector.errorAreaDetectType: Area detection method is required (when event condition is "Only on area entry/exit")
collector.errorDetectArea: Detection area is required (when event condition is "Only on area entry/exit")
collector.errorDetectAreaPoints: Detection area must have 3 or more coordinate points
collector.errorDetectAreaFormat: Detection area must be in valid JSON format
collector.areaDetectMethodTrackIds: Detect by Track ID change (individual identification)
collector.areaDetectMethodCount: Detect by count change (avoid accuracy issues)
collector.areaDetectMethodHelp: Track ID change: For individual identification. Count change: To avoid YOLO accuracy issues
collector.errorAreaDetectMethod: Area detection method is required (when event condition is "Only on area entry/exit")
collector.notAvailableForS3: - Available for cameras other than type="s3"
collector.onlyForS3: - Only available for cameras with type="s3"
collector.detectAreaEditorInstructions: Click on the video to add points. Click the first point (red) to close the polygon. You need at least 3 points to save.
collector.detectAreaEditorPolygonOpen: Polygon: Incomplete (click the first point to close)
collector.detectAreaEditorNoVSaaSConfig: VSaaS camera API key or device ID is not configured

detector.detectIntervalHelp: Detection interval for real-time capture. Default: 5000ms (5 seconds)
detector.lambdaArnHelpBedrock: Lambda ARN is auto-configured for bedrock type
detector.lambdaArnHelpCustom: Enter Lambda function ARN for Custom Detector (e.g., arn:aws:lambda:ap-northeast-1:123456789012:function:my-detector)
detector.modelSizeWarning: ⚠️ Non-Nova models cannot analyze files larger than 25MB
detector.temperatureHelp: Lower for strict, higher for diversity. Default: 0.1 (0.0-1.0)
detector.topPHelp: Top percentage of vocabulary to consider. Default: 0.5 (0.0-1.0)
detector.compareFile: File Comparison (Compare with previous file to judge situation)
detector.tagSettings: Tags and Tag Output Criteria (What criteria must be met for a tag to be output)
detector.errorLambdaArn: Lambda ARN is required when using Custom Detector.
detector.eventNotify: Event Notification (Enable saving to detect-log and notifications)

tagCategory.title: Select Tag Category
tagCategory.description: Select a tag category to load

bookmark.noBookmarks: No bookmarks available. Please create a new one.

reportCreate.resultPlaceholder: The report will be displayed here after creation
reportCreate.modelIdHelp: Enter the Bedrock model ID to use
reportCreate.defaultContent: First, state the date and place name (place_name). Then, pick up safety-related issues from the attached data and describe them in (1) as incidents that occurred. Next, summarize (2) safety concerns, then provide (3) improvement suggestions, and finally (4) conclude the report. If there is an image_url for the picked-up incidents, attach it as an image in (1). Also, use indentation to make it easy to read.
